intro: Ruprechtia zernyi, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Its flowers are often used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits. Ruprechtia zernyi thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
